meanings.definition: Used to express alarm or surprise.
meanings.sent2: When I saw the mouse, I couldn't help but eek in surprise.
meanings.sent3: Eek! I almost spilled my drink when the balloon popped.
meanings.sent4: The sudden thunder made her eek in fear.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected loud noise made everyone eek with surprise.

meanings.definition: A sound made in response to fear or shock.
meanings.sent1: The eek from the haunted house sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: I heard a little eek coming from the dark corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The eek of the scared kitten was so adorable.
meanings.sent4: The eek of the brakes made the driver slam on the brakes.
meanings.sent5: The sudden eek in the night made everyone jump in fear.
